Package userinterface

Class ContentFrame

java.lang.Object
userinterface.AbstractFrame
userinterface.ContentFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
DocumentListener
public class ContentFrame
extends AbstractFrame
implements DocumentListener
A class to represent frames containing content to be displayed in browsr, extended from AbstractFrame.

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type Field Description
    UIController controller
    The UIController related to this ContentFrame.

    • controller

      public UIController controller
      The UIController related to this ContentFrame.

  • Constructor Details

    • ContentFrame

      public ContentFrame​(int x, int y, int width, int height) throws IllegalDimensionException
      Construct a ContentFrame with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      x - : The x coordinate of the ContentFrame.
      y - : The y coordinate of the ContentFrame.
      width - : The width of the ContentFrame.
      height - : The height of the ContentFrame.
      Throws:
      IllegalDimensionException - : When one of the dimensions is negative.

    • ContentFrame

      public ContentFrame​(int x, int y, int width, int height, int siblingId)
      Initialize a ContentFrame with the given ContentFrame parameters and an siblingId as a reference for which page should be loaded.
      Parameters:
      x - : The x coordinate of the ContentFrame.
      y - : The y coordinate of the ContentFrame.
      width - : The width of the ContentFrame.
      height - : The height of the ContentFrame.
      siblingId - : The id of another Pane object whose page should be copied.

  • Method Details

    • render

      public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Renders the content. The content renders its sub-content recursively if existent.
      Specified by:
      render in class AbstractFrame
      Parameters:
      g - : The graphics to be rendered

    • handleResize

      public void handleResize​(int newWindowWidth, int newWindowHeight)
      If the new window dimensions are legal, the UserInterface.ContentFrame gets resized. It also resizes its content.
      Specified by:
      handleResize in class AbstractFrame
      Parameters:
      newWindowWidth - : The new window width of this LeafPane
      newWindowHeight - : The new window height of this LeafPane

    • handleMouse

      public void handleMouse​(int id, int x, int y, int clickCount, int button, int modifiersEx)
      What to do when mouse is pressed? Check the following things:
      • -> Was it on me?
      • -> Was it the right button?
      • -> Is it the right MouseEvent?
      • => Handle the result accordingly
      => If all yes, send the click to content. The result of this could be a href String or the Empty String.
      Specified by:
      handleMouse in class AbstractFrame
      Parameters:
      id - : The type of mouse activity
      x - : The x coordinate of the mouse activity
      y - : The y coordinate of the mouse activity
      clickCount - : The number of clicks
      button - : The mouse button that was clicked
      modifiersEx - : The control keys that were held on the click

    • handleKey

      public void handleKey​(int id, int keyCode, char keyChar, int modifiersEx)
      Handle key presses. This method does the right action when a key is pressed.
      Specified by:
      handleKey in class AbstractFrame
      Parameters:
      id - : The KeyEvent (Associated with type of KeyEvent)
      keyCode - : The KeyEvent code (Determines the involved key)
      keyChar - : The character representation of the involved key
      modifiersEx - : Specifies other keys that were involved in the event

    • contentChanged

      public void contentChanged()
      Notify the LeafPane that the contents have been changed
      Specified by:
      contentChanged in interface DocumentListener

    • setContent

      public void setContent​(DocumentCell content)
      Set the content of this ContentFrame to the provided ContentSpan. The content to be set is wrapped in a UITable for easy decoration using the HorizontalScrollBarDecorator and VerticalScrollBarDecorator decorators.
      Parameters:
      content - : The content that should be set.

    • setWelcomeDocument

      protected void setWelcomeDocument()
      Set the contents of this ContentFrame to the Welcome Document.

    • getContent

      public DocumentCell getContent()
      Retrieve the contents of this ContentFrame.
      Returns:
      contentSpan: A ContentSpan that denotes the contents of this ContentFrame.
